Pilkades Hambat Penyaluran Dana Desa
05 Nov 2019, 13:37 by Hilmi Abdul Halim
PURWAKARTA, (PR).- Pemilihan Kepala Desa di 1.835 desa se-Jawa Barat menghambat penyaluran dana desa. Meskipun demikian, Kepala Dinas Pemberdayaan Masyarakat dan Desa Provinsi Jawa Barat, Dedi Sopandi meyakinkan bantuan tersebut akan tetap terserap oleh masing-masing desa.
"Dalam posisi Pilkades, kepala desa petahana itu cuti atau nonaktif digantikan PJS (pelaksana jabatan sementara). Ada lagi transfer pekerjaan, proposal, tidak terdistribusi dengan baik," kata Dedi, Selasa 5 November 2019. Hal-hal seperti itu, tuturnya, menghambat proses administrasi di desa tersebut.
Namun, ia meminta masyarakat bersabar dan tidak perlu khawatir bantuan pemerintah tersebut tidak tersalurkan. Menurutnya, penyerapan dana desa tinggal menunggu waktu karena tertunda tahapan Pilkades yang menjadi pekerjaan tambahan bagi para pegawai desa.
"(Penyaluran dana desa yang tertunda) itu tidak akan mengganggu pelayanan masyarakat karena PJS yang ditunjuk pun adalah pegawai yang berkualitas," kata Dedi menegaskan. 
83 Desa di Purwakarta
Melihat dari pelaksanaan Pilkades serentak kali ini, pemerintah daerah dituntut untuk lebih mempersiapkan rencana pelaksanaannya ke depannya. Sehingga, Pilkades tidak sampai mengganggu penyaluran dana desa di desa tersebut.
Salah satu daerah yang akan melaksanakan Pilkades serentak pada 2020 mendatang ialah Kabupaten Purwakarta. DPMD setempat telah mengalokasikan anggaran sebesar hampir Rp 8 miliar meskipun tahapan Pilkades di 83 desa baru akan dimulai pada awal tahun depan.
"Secara keseluruhan anggaran kami siapkan sebesar Rp 7,9 miliar termasuk untuk pengamanan dan lain-lain," ujar Kepala DPMD Kabupaten Purwakarta, Panda Dinata. Ia merinci kebutuhan anggaran itu berdasarkan jumlah hak pilih pada Pilkades kali ini.
Panda menyebutkan alokasi anggarannya sebesar Rp 25 ribu untuk setiap hak pilih. Sementara itu, jumlah hak pilih secara keseluruhan di 83 desa tersebut mencapai 299.125 orang pemilih. Hal itu menurutnya sudah disetujui oleh bupati dan Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Daerah.
Anggaran tersebut bersumber dari bantuan keuangan pemerintah pusat yang langsung diserahkan ke setiap desa dan panitia Pilkades. Panda menegaskan penyalurannya tidak melalui pemerintah daerah maupun dinas terkait.
Lebih lanjut, Panda mengakui jajarannya belum juga menentukan waktu pelaksanaan pemungutan suara Pilkades serentak 2020. "Hanya yang jadi bahan pertimbangan untuk pelaksanaan jangan sampai bentrok dengan pelaksanan ibadah haji karena dikhawatirkan ada calon yang ikut berhaji. Kalau bisa sebelum atau setelah hajian," tuturnya.***

Pilkades Inhibits Distribution of Village Funds
05 Nov 2019, 13:37 by Hilmi Abdul Halim
PURWAKARTA, (PR) .- Election of Village Heads in 1,835 villages in West Java impedes the distribution of village funds. Nevertheless, the Head of the West Java Provincial Community and Village Empowerment Office, Dedi Sopandi, assured that the assistance would still be absorbed by each village.
"In the Pilkades position, the incumbent village head was on leave or inactive was replaced by a PJS (implementing temporary position). There was another job transfer, proposal, not well distributed," Dedi said, Tuesday, November 5, 2019. Things like that, he said, hampered administrative processes in the village.
However, he asked the public to be patient and not have to worry that government assistance would not be distributed. According to him, the absorption of village funds is only a matter of time due to the delayed Pilkades stage which becomes additional work for village employees.
"(Delayed disbursement of village funds) will not interfere with community service because the designated PJS is also a qualified employee," said Dedi stressed.
83 Villages in Purwakarta
Seeing from the simultaneous Pilkades implementation this time, the regional government is demanded to better prepare the implementation plan in the future. Thus, Pilkades does not interfere with the distribution of village funds in the village.
One of the regions that will hold simultaneous Pilkades in 2020 is Purwakarta Regency. The local DPMD has allocated a budget of nearly Rp 8 billion, although the Pilkades phase in 83 new villages will start early next year.
"Overall, we have prepared a budget of Rp 7.9 billion, including security and others," said Head of Purwakarta Regency DPMD, Panda Dinata. He detailed the budget needs based on the number of voting rights in the Pilkades this time.
Panda mentioned the budget allocation of Rp. 25 thousand for each vote. Meanwhile, the total number of voting rights in the 83 villages reached 299,125 voters. According to him, this was agreed by the regent and the Regional House of Representatives.
The budget is sourced from central government financial assistance which is directly submitted to each village and Pilkades committee. Panda stressed that the distribution was not through the local government or related agencies.
Furthermore, Panda admitted that his staff had not yet determined the timing of the Pilkades voting at the same time 2020. "Only those that are considered for implementation should not clash with the pilgrimage because it is feared that there will be candidates for the pilgrimage. If possible before or after the pilgrimage," he said. ***
